Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future; Fatmata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат жизнерадостная и порядочная женщина. Она замужем и имеет взрослых детей. Сама она предприниматель и имеет торговую точку на местном рынке. Она занимается продажей женской и мужской обуви, одежды для детей и женщин. Свою деятельность она начала с 1996 года. И по сей день она продолжает развивать свой бизнес и получать доход. Её муж и сын находятся на заработках в России. Каждый месяц они отправляют в семью денежные средства. Другой сын работает таксистом в своём посёлке. От этой работы он имеет стабильный заработок. Сейчас Назокат хочет женить своего старшего сына. В данный момент она занимается подготовкой свадебного мероприятия. Но всех денежных средств, которые накопила Назокат не достаточно, чтобы полностью покрыть все расходы по свадьбе. Поэтому Назокат обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить приданное для своего сына на свадьбу. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nazokat is a cheerful and respectable woman. She is married and has grown-up children. She is an entrepreneur and has a retail shop at the local market. She sells women's and men's shoes as well as clothes for women and children. She started her business in 1996. To the present day, she continues to develop her business and receive an income. Her husband and son work in Russia. Every month they send remittances home to the family. Her other son works as a taxi driver in his own village. He has a stabile income from this job. 

Now Nazokat wants to help her eldest son get married. She is currently working on preparations for the wedding ceremony. But all of the money which Nazokat has already saved is not enough to completely cover the wedding expenses. This is why Nazokat turned to Arvand to receive a loan to buy a dowry for her son's wedding. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: To buy a dowry for her son's wedding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Aminata from Waterloo, a rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  For the past 5 years, Aminata established her retail business. She began her business, because she wants to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy different kinds of teddy bears to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Aminata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of teddy bears to expand her business.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1989 года. Динара не замужем и живет с родителями. Она после окончания средней школы не поступила в университет, так как ее родители не имели денег. Динара решила организовать бизнес и таким образом стать успешной бизнес леди. Она более 3 лет занимается скотоводством. Она в основном откармливает мелко – рогатого скота. Она покупает скот, откармливает 2-3 месяца и продает на местном рынке более высокой ценой. Мать Динары помогает ей по откармливанию скота. Она постепенно развевает бизнес. Динара хочет увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dinara is a young and determined woman. She was born in 1989. Dinara is unmarried and lives with her parents. After graduating from secondary school, she did not attend university as her parents did not have the money for it. Dinara decided to put together a business and as a result, she became a successful businesswoman. For more than three years, she has practiced animal breeding. She primarily fattens up small cattle. She buys livestock, fattens them up for 2 to 3 months, and then sells them at the local market for a higher price. Dinara's mother helps her fatten up the cattle. She is gradually developing her business. Dinara want to increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano de 45 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su querida esposa en casa de su propiedad. Mariano es agricultor y se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras (chiles y tomates) para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar.  Su deseo es mejorar sus ventas y así obtener mejores ingresos con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de tomates y chiles al por mayor para llevar sus  verduras a más clientes y así poder cumplir su objetivo de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mariano is 45 years old and lives in very humble circumstances with his beloved wife, in their own home. He is a farmer and also works buying and selling vegetables (chili peppers and tomatoes), in order to make a living and support his household. His hope is to increase his sales and so make a greater income, with the aim of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

He is seeking this credit from FUSAI to invest it in buying tomatoes and chili peppers at wholesale, and so take his vegetables to more customers and so be able to achieve his goal of give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and chili peppers at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Meet Amie, she is 42 years old from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  Over the past 11 years, Amie established her retail business. She began her business, because she wanted to be self sufficient.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Amie requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and coal nut to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Amie plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and coal nut to expand her business.

loans.name: Shermamat

texts.ru:
Шермамат родился и поживает в деревне Янгиёр в районе Вахш. Ему 50 лет. Шермамат счастливый отец троих детей и любящий муж. Старший сын Шермамата находится за пределами страны. Он живет и работает в Российской Федерации. Его сын оставил родную деревню, чтобы улучшить жизненные условия семьи. 
   Шермамат у себя дома имеет маленький магазинчик, где продает продукты питания и ткани для шитья. Дополнительно, Шермамат более 10 лет занимается скотоводством, у него есть одна корова. Его корову вы можете увидеть на фотографии. Шермамат хочет взять кредит и купить бычков, телят и корма для них. Он надеется найти больше выгоды от такой деятельности. Шермамат надеется на Вашу помощь!
texts.en:
Shermamat was born and lives in the village Yangiyer in Vakhsh district. He is 50 years old . Shermamat is happy father of three children and a loving husband . Shermamat's eldest son lives outside the country. He lives and works in the Russian Federation. His son left his village to improve the living conditions of his family.
   

Shermamat has a small shop where he sells food items and fabrics for sewing. Additionally, Shermamat for more than 10 years has been engaged in cattle breeding, and he has one cow. You can see his cow in the photo. Shermamat wants to take a loan and buy calfs and a feed for them. He hopes to make additional profit from these activities. Shermamat is hoping for your help!

loans.use: to increase his livestock count

loans.name: Gayratjon

texts.ru:
Гайратчону 41 год. Он женат. Его жена врач. Дети Гайратчона учатся в школе. Гайратчон со своей семьей живет на районе Спитамен. В Спитамене чистый воздух и необычайная природа. Не только в Спитамене, но и во всей территории Таджикистана Вы можете увидеть прекрасные долины, не неповторимую красоту гор и гостеприимных таджиков.
    Гайратчон пользуясь чистым воздухом и прекрасным климатом Таджикистана начал заниматься куплей и продажей скотов. Воздух и климат республики благоприятный для такой деятельности. Гайратчон много лет занимается скотоводством и знает все о своей деятельности. На сегодняшний день у Гайратчона возникли финансовые трудности, и ему потребуется деньги для закупки скотов. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Гайратчон очень надеется, что ему помогут. Он ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Gayratjon is 41 and married. His wife is a doctor and his children are in school. Gayratjon and his family live in the Spitamen region, where there is clean air and the nature is exceptional. You can find wonderful valleys, unique beauty and welcoming Tajiks not just in Spitamen, but in all of Tajikistan.  

Gayratjon has made use of the clean air and wonderful climate of Tajikistan to start a business buying and selling cattle. The air and climate of the republic are conducive to such an occupation. He has worked in animal husbandry for many years and knows everything about his occupation. At the moment he is having financial difficulties and he needs money to purchase cattle. For this reason he is requesting a loan. Gayratjon hopes very much for assistance, and awaits your help.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase his head count

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Замиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Замира занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 8 кобыл и 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zamira is 39 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Zamira has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Zamira practices livestock breeding. She started this business 19 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zamira's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 1 calf, 8 mares and 1 horse on her farm. Her monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS).  For the purpose of further developing her business, Zamira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy calves to increase the size of her herd. Zamira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза женщина с прекрасными мыслями. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она живет вместе со своими детьми в сельской местности. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она занимается купле продажей сухофруктов на местном рынке. Данным бизнесом она занимается уже более 5 лет. Фируза торгует на местном рынке и имеет свою торговую точку. Фируза постепенно развевает свой бизнес и свои навыки по введению бизнеса. Фируза хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Firuza is a woman with wonderful ideas. She is married and is raising three children. She lives with her children in a rural area. Her husband is a labor migrant in the Russian Federation. She buys and sells dried fruits at the local market. She has been doing this business for more than 5 years. Firuza sells at the local market and has her own stall. Firuza is gradually developing both her business and her business management skills. Firuza wants to repair her house as it is bad shape. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, lumber, etc. to repair her house. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement and lumber for repairing her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture, such as beds for sleeping and a sofa.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Isatu from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown. She is single with 2 children.  She started her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. In 2009, Isatu established her general store business.  She works at the business from 8:00am to 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat, pepper, and spices for her business.

loans.name: Mirna Dinora

texts.es: Mirna de 30 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija de 5 años y su hijo de 8 años de edad quienes ya se encuentran en la escuela más cercana de su localidad. Para Mirna sus hijos son su principal motivación y es por ellos que trabaja duramente para sacarlos adelante y darles mejores oportunidades de vida. Mirna se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza tales como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, etc. Además, también vende variedad de joyería enchapada de oro y acero la cual comercializa en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de joyería (anillos, cadenas, pulseras, etc.) ya que es el producto que más le demandan sus clientes y del que más ganancia obtiene. Espera poder contar con este apoyo ya que su deseo es incrementar sus ingresos y de esta forma dar a sus hijos un mejor desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mirna is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her 5-year-old daughter and 8-year-old son, who attend the nearest school. For Mirna, her children are her main motivation in life, and it is for them that she works hard, to help them do well and give them better opportunities in life. She works selling beauty products such as lotions, deodorants, creams, etc, as well as a variety of gold-plated and steel jewelry, in different parts of the city.

With the aim of expanding her business she is seeking this loan from FUSAI, in order to invest it in buying a range of jewelry (rings, chains, bracelets, etc.), as this is the product most in demand with her customers and which provides her with the most income. She hopes to receive this support as her which is to improve her income and so give her children a better upbringing.

loans.use: to buy jewelry such as rings, chains, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 26 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a domestic products shop in Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown. She started her business because she wants to improve her family's conditions.  

She has been in this business since after the war. She sells glass cups, knives, and food containers to her community.  She says that the main challenge to her business is improper location.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a domestic products shop in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started her business because she wants to improve the conditions of her family.  

She has been in this business since after the war. She sells glass cups, bowls, and food containers to her community.  She says that the main problem  facing her business is improper location.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to build a boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусатор позитивный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 47 лет. Женат и имеет троих детей. Он сотрудничает с Арванд уже несколько лет. Первый свой кредит Абдусатор получил для развития своего собственного бизнеса. Он начал бизнес животноводства. Его жена не работает, она является домохозяйкой, заботиться и ухаживает за детьми. Чтобы иметь хороший заработок, которого будет достаточно на удовлетворение всех имеющихся нужд семьи, Абдусатор занимается бизнесом. Он выращивает и продаёт скот. А также продаёт молоко, полученное от этого скота. Сейчас он хочет расширить свой бизнес, увеличить поголовье своего скота и потом получать больше прибыли, чтобы у его семьи хватало денежных средств на все семейные расходы. Он надеется, что этот бизнес поможет ему улучшить экономическое положении своей семьи. Поэтому Абдусатор обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Abdusattor is a positive and hardworking man who is 47 years old. He is married and has three children. He has partnered with Arvand for several years already. The first loan Abdusattor received was to develop his own business. He started a business breeding livestock. His wife does not work. She is a homemaker and looks after their children. In order to have a good income which will be enough to satisfy all of his family's needs, Abdusattor works at his business. He raises and sells cattle. He also sells the milk which he gets from these cattle. Now he wants to expand his business, increase the size of his herd and then receive a bigger profit so that his family can have enough financial resources to cover all of their family expenses. He hopes that this business will help him improve the economic situation of his family. This is why Abdusattor turned to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to buy more cattle. He thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Mahfiza

texts.ru: Махфизе 38 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится за пределами страны на заработках. Махфиза со своими детьми живет у родителей. Там же она занимается скотоводством. Махфиза около 8 лет занимается животноводством. Для нее это основной и единственный доход. Она занимается такой деятельностью, потому что это выгодный бизнес, и она знает все о своей деятельности. На данный момент у Махфизы финансовые затруднения и чтобы купить несколько голов скота ей необходимо больше средств, чем она имеет. Поэтому она просит кредит. Махфиза надеется, что ей помогут. Она ждет в Вашей помощи!
texts.en: Mahfiza is 38 years old. She is married. Her husband is working abroad. Mahfiza and her children live at her parents' house. She practices animal breeding there. Mahfiza has been practicing animal breeding for about eight years. It is both her primary and only source of income. She does this type of work because it is a profitable business and she knows everything there is to know about her business. She is currently having financial difficulties and in order to buy more cattle, she needs a large amount of money which she does not have. This is why she is requesting a loan. Mahfiza hopes that you are able to help her. She awaits your help!

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 41 años, está casada con Vilma y tiene 3 hijos teniendo su casa de material noble como vivienda para su familia. Inicialmente se desempeñaba como trabajador en otros terrenos y después de dos  años  gracias a su firme trabajo y ahorro junto a su esposa logró adquirir un terreno para dedicarlo íntegramente a la producción de los productos más rentables de su zona como es el cacao orgánico; entre otros.
Viene dedicándose a este honrado oficio casi 11 años y ha logrado mediante la venta de sus productos mantener económicamente a sus hijos. Una de sus principales ventajas es que posee terrenos muy fértiles que favorecen al crecimiento del cacao orgánico, barbasco y otros, no obstante sus terrenos se encuentran algo distancias de la ciudad el cual dificulta el traslado de sus cosechas hasta los centros de compra de su localidad. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 500.00 nuevos soles para proceder con la compra de herramientas de cultivo sobre las que secará sus productos y además adquirir herramientas.
texts.en:
Alberto is 41 years old. He is married to Vilma and has 3 children and he has a brick house where his family lives. Initially, he worked as a laborer on other lands and after two years, thanks to his hard work and savings with his wife he was able to acquire land to produce the most profitable crops in the area such as organic cacao and more.  

He has been working in this honorable trade for almost 11 years and through selling his products has been able to support his children financially. One of the main advantages that his land has is that it is very fertile and favors the growth of organic cacao, barbasco and more. Nonetheless, his land is very far from the city which makes it difficult to transport his harvests to the buying centers in his community. This is his third loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support that he is receiving to get ahead. He is also committed to making his payments on time. He wants to have 500.00 nuevos soles to buy farming tools to dry his products and also acquire tools.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es: Melissa, con tan sólo 19 años de edad, se dedica hace algún tiempo a atender su propio negocio, una venta de alimentos fritos que ofrece en un carrito ambulante; esta actividad surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar, pues luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, ella no tenía los recursos económicos para pagar estudios universitarios y adicionalmente era difícil emplearse en una empresa debido a la falta de experiencia laboral, por lo que se dedicó tiempo completo a su pequeño negocio. Su empuje, actitud emprendedora y su proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas la motivan a seguir luchando incansablemente, por lo que se motiva para solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito con el que desea realizar mejoras a su puesto de trabajo (pintar el carro ambulante) y comprar insumos al por mayor (papas, plátanos, salsas, limón, aceite), esto le permitirá ofrecer una mejor imagen al negocio que cambie la percepción de los transeúntes y que estos puedan convertirse en clientes potenciales, aumentando así sus ventas y el margen de ganancias que obtiene. De esta manera Melissa desea seguir trabajando arduamente para llegar a cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores ingresos que le den la oportunidad de pagar sus estudios universitarios y convertirse en una profesional; lo que para ella significa poseer una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Melissa, only 19 years old, has been dedicated for some time to managing her own business, selling fried food that she offers from a moving cart. This work came from the need to generate income to support her home since after completing her high school education she didn't have the economic resources to pay for university education and additionally, it was difficult to find work with a company due to her lack of work experience. As a result, she dedicated all her time to her small business. Her drive, entrepreneurial spirit and projection toward achieving her goals motivate her to keep fighting tirelessly. Thus she is motivated to request her first loan cycle with the desire to make improvements to her stall (paint the cart) and to buy ingredients at wholesale (potatoes, bananas, sauces, lemon, oil). This will allow her to offer a better image to her business that changes the perception of passersby and they can become potential customers increasing her sales and the profit margin she earns. In this way, Melissa wishes to keep working hard to achieve her dream of expanding her business to generate better income which will give her the opportunity to pay for university education and become a professional, which to her means having a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to make improvements to her stall (paint the cart) and to buy ingredients at wholesale (potatoes, bananas, sauces, lemon, oil).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gbassray

texts.en:
Gbassray is 25 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a retail business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started her business to earn a living.

Gbassray has been in this business since after the rebel war. She sells a variety of local food and drinks to her community.  She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Gbassray requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bread, bag sugar and assorted drinks for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bread, bag sugar and assorted drinks for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mabinty from Tombo, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  After she got married, Mabinty established her retail business. She started her business because she needed to earn income to support her household. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week moving around the community to sell her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more cooking commodities to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Mabinty plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking commodities to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is in her late twenties and married with 2 children between 2 years and 10 years old. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She strives for her living.

She has been in this business since she left school. She sells sugar, milk, cigarette and biscuits to her community.  She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she wishes to increase her business more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años de edad, es casada actualmente vive junto a sus hijos, su esposo y su mamá, los cuales están estudiando y en sus tiempos libres el mayor le ayuda a su papá en el negocio, ella estudio hasta el 5° grado, trabaja como empleada en una casa vecina, su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra     


Ana tiene más de 15 años trabajando como empleada doméstica, en la casa de los vecinos. Ella decidió empezar a trabajar debido a que en ese tiempo, su esposo se quedó sin trabajo y no lograba encontrar después con el esfuerzo de ella lograron comprar un carro, que es con el cual ahora su esposo se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de chatarra    


El préstamo será invertido, en el negocio de la compra de chatarra,  ya que se han quedado sin capital, con esto podrán mejorar nuevamente sus ingresos familiares 

A futuro quieren seguir trabajando, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida de toda su familia y con la oportunidad del crédito ve un potencial de crecimiento en el negocio y así brindarle la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ana is 37, married, and lives with her children, her husband, and her mother. The children go to school and the eldest helps his father with the family business in his spare time. Ana studied until the 5th form and works as an employee in a neighbouring house. Her husband buys and sells scrap metal. Ana has been working as a domestic employee for 15 years in her neighbours' house. She started working at a time when her husband had just lost his job and could not find another one. Thanks to her efforts, they managed to buy a car, which the husband now uses to buy and sell scrap metal. The loan will be used to buy scrap metal to sell, since they have no money left to do so. With this loan, they will be able to improve their family income once again. Ana's plans for the future include keeping her job in order to improve her whole family's standard of living. She sees this loan as a growth opportunity for the family business, one that will help her give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to sell.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: Amanda tiene 59 años, es viuda y vive junto al último de sus hijos de nombre Maicol con 12 años en su vivienda hecha a base de material noble. Inicialmente se dedicaba a la preparación y  venta de comida en el mercado de abastos en su localidad logrando con ello iniciar la construcción de su vivienda y reunir dinero para cumplir uno de sus principales objetivos que fue habilitar el primer piso de su vivienda e iniciar un negocio consistente en su tienda de productos comestibles. Lleva 10 años con el negocio y con el paso de los años ha logrado consolidarlo como un buen sustento para su economía familiar.Gracias a la venta de productos de primera necesidad así como el arroz, azúcar y demás cereales mas consumidos  ha logrado desempeñar su negocio convirtiéndose en una vecina conocida en su barrio, complementa su negocio con la venta de refresco preparados a base de frutas de la región como mango y naranjas gracias a una maquina expendedora de refrescos que posee. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 500.00 nuevos soles para la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Amanda is 59 years old. She is a widow and has lived for the last twelve years with the last of her children, whose name is Maicol, in her house made from noble material. Initially, she was dedicated to making and selling food in the grocery market in her area, managing through this to start the construction of her house and collect money to achieve one of her main objectives which was to complete the first floor of her house and start a consistent business in her consumable products shop.

She's had the business for ten years and with the passing of years she has managed to consolidate it as a good livelihood for her family. Thanks to the sale of basic necessity products like rice, sugar, and the most popular cereals, she has managed to start her business turning herself into one of the most well known neighbors in her neighborhood. She complements her business with selling prepared drinks that are based on fruit from the area like mango and oranges thanks to a vending machine she owns. This is her third loan with Kiva and she feels thankful for the financial support that she receives to get ahead. Also, she promises to make her payments punctually. At this time she wishes to obtain 500 PEN to buy consumable products like rice, sugar, milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy consumable products like rice, sugar, milk, among other things.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is in her late twenties and married with 2 children. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since she left school and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water for resale.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José es  un señor casado de 31 años de edad, actualmente vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 8,5 y 3 años en el Departamento de  Sololá.
Comenta que se dedica a dos trabajos,  uno es  de albañil que lo realiza por las mañanas y el otro  es de mesero  de un restaurante y lo realiza por las tardes.  Eligió estas dos actividades  porque su padre le enseño desde pequeño la actividad de la albañilería y la otra actividad porque recibió cursos de mesero. 
Ahora cuenta con varios años de experiencia en ambas actividades, pero ha tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para invertir en un negocio de una panadería con el fin de mejorar  su situación económica y así aportar a la economía de su familia. El préstamo lo pagara con los ingresos de sus dos trabajos.
Su sueño es generar ganancias a través de su panadería y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a married, 31 year old man. He lives with his wife and their three children, aged 8, 5 and 3, in the Sololá department. He says that he has two jobs. One of them is as a bricklayer, which he does in the morning. The other is as a waiter in a restaurant in the afternoon. He opted to do these two activities because his father taught bricklaying to him when he was young and the other activity because he took classes on waiting tables. 

Now he was several years' experience in both activities, but he has taken the initiative of asking for a loan of Q 6,000.00 to invest in a bread bakery business in order to improve his financial situation and thus contribute to his family budget. He will pay for the loan with the income from his two jobs. His dream is to generate income through the bread bakery and in this way improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a bread baking business.

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y luchador, que solo estudio hasta el tercer grado, desde entonces se dedicó al cultivo de granos básicos, actualmente esta acompañado, tiene tres hijos 8, 6 y 1 año de edad respectivamente)  los cuales dos están estudiando.


José posee  más de 20 años de dedicarse al trabajo agrícola, además se dedica a hacer viajes con un pick-up, el negocio del cultivo de los granos básicos lo aprendió de su padre, quien le enseño todas las técnicas necesarias para el cultivo. 
 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para la recolección de la cosecha de los granos de maíz, pagara mano de obra que le ayudaran a la recolección, comprara un granero más para almacenar el maíz recolectado, y el resto del crédito será invertido en la reparación del vehículo,  el cual también le servirá para el transporte del maíz hacia su casa. 


A futuro el señor , quiere que su familia este siempre unida, poder sacar a sus hijos adelante en sus estudios, tiene un sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en todos unos profesionales y que no les falte lo mínimo dentro del hogar.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old. He is a hardworking man who is a fighter. He only went to school up to the third grade, and since then has worked growing basic grains. He is in a common law marriage and has three children aged 8, 6 and 1. Two of them are in school. 

José has been farming for more than 20 years. He also makes trips in his pick-up. He learned the business of growing basic grains from his father, who taught him the necessary techniques for the crops. 
 
The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to harvest the corn crop. He will pay for the labor to help in the harvest. He will also buy another granary to store the harvested corn. The rest of the loan will be invested in vehicle repair. This will also be used to transport the corn to his house. 

In the future, he wants his family to always be close and to be able to get his children ahead in their studies. He has a dream of seeing his children graduate from college and lack for nothing in their home.

loans.use: to harvest corn. He will pay for labor to help in the harvest and buy another granary to store the harvested corn. The rest of the loan will be invested in vehicle repair. This will also be used to transport the corn to his house.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is in her late thirties and married with 4 children. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started the business because she wanted to improve the condition of her family.  

She's been in this business since after the war and sells glass cups, knives and food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is improper business location.

Fatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and varieties of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to build a boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and varieties of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She's been in this business since right after she got married, and she sells palm oil within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profits she was able to bring to her family.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гульбахор 50-летняя замужняя женщина, собирающая начать бизнес по животноводству в своем районе Шахритус. Для выращивания мелкого рогатого скота у нее имеются благоприятные условия. У Гульбахор при дворе дома есть сарай для содержания скота, корм для скота, а также имеется пастбище. Кроме того Гульбахор имеет достаточный опыт в разведении скота. В данный момент она вместе с двумя дочерьми занимается растениеводством. Ее муж и один сын находятся на заработках в России. Гульбахор берет кредит, чтобы закупить 10 голов овец и баранов. Она считает овцеводство прибыльным бизнесом, не требующим тяжелой работы. Если она успешно начнет этот бизнес финансовое положение ее семьи улучшится, у них появится новый источник дохода и ее мужу и сыну больше не придется ехать на заработки в чужие края.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a 50-year-old married woman planning to start an animal breeding business in her district of Shahrituz. She has a conducive environment  for raising small livestock. In Gulbahor's backyard she has a barn for housing cattle, food for them, as well as a pasture. Besides that, Gulbahor has significant experience in raising cattle. She currently practices crop farming with her two daughters. Her husband and son work in Russia. Gulbahor is requesting a loan in order to buy 10 sheep and rams. She considers sheep breeding a profitable business which does not require strenuous work. If she successfully starts this business, her family's financial situation will improve. They will have a new source of income and her husband and son will not have to work abroad in a foreign country anymore.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and rams in order to start her sheep breeding business.

loans.name: Fatamta

texts.en:
Fatmata is in her late 30's and married with two children. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo's western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business because she wants to improve the conditions of her family.  

She's got into this business after she got married.  She sells glass cups, knifes, and food containers with her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is an improper business location.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell. 

She says the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and build a permanent business structure. 

In the future, she would like to build a boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Haja from Tombo's western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children; two of her children are going to school. 

After the war, Haja established her rubber slippers business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week, moving around the community to sell her goods. She says the main challenge to her business is slow sales during the raining season.

Haja requires a loan to buy more rubber slippers to sell. She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, Haja plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber slippers to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Isatu from Tombo's western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. Three of her children are going to school. 

After she got married, Isatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week, moving around the community to sell her goods. She says the main challenge to her business lack of sufficient capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan to buy more cooking commodities to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future; Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking commodities to expand her business.

loans.name: Dúo Luchadoras De San Pedro Group

texts.es: La encargada de este grupo es la señora María Elena quien se dedica a la venta de frutas como naranja, manzana, piñas, banano, uvas, plátano y más. Las personas ya están pidiendo manzanas, uvas, plátanos por mayor porque las fiestas de fin de año se aproximan y doña María Elena no cuenta con mucho capital para comprar las cajas de frutas que le hacen falta, por eso ella pide un crédito para no quedarles mal a sus clientes y comprar la fruta que le falta.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is the head of the Duo Luchadoras de San Pedro Group. She works selling fruit such as oranges, apples, pineapples, bananas, grapes and plantains. Maria Elena says that with the end-of-the-year celebrations approaching, people are now placing wholesale orders for apples, grapes and plantains, but she does not have enough capital to buy the crates of fruit that she needs. 

Maria Elena is requesting this loan to buy the fruit that she needs so that she does not leave her customers unsatisfied.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with three children and lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a snack vending business in the local community to earn a living. For the nine years she has been in the business, Edith has earned well and has been able to keep her children in school. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC micro-credit that she used for this business was successfully repaid. Currently, she has taken a new loan to purchase raw ingredients and fruits to resell. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her family's living situation, and to support her children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing from Erlian, China to sell in her booth.

loans.name: Mongonsaraa

texts.en:
Mrs. Mongonsaraa is a 32-year-old single mother of two who lives in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her two sons go to a local school and a kindergarten. 

Mongonsaraa started her own business soon after her husband passed away in 2010. She has been operating her clothing retail business in a rental booth in the local market since then. 

She is a tough, hardworking, and diligent woman who is now in need of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventories from Erlian, China to sell at her counter. 

She leaves her sons at her relatives when she goes to Erlian, China for inventories.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventories from Erlian, China to sell at her counter

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is 23 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Elmie has a motorcycle transport operating business and earns approximately Php 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used to pay the registration renewal of their motorcycle unit for hire.
 
Elmie has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Elmie hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To pay the registration renewal of their motorcycle unit for hire

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that their house will be renovated. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is widow with two children who runs a general store to earn a living. 

For the three years she has been in this business, Maricon has earned well for their daily living. 

She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery goods to sell. She is hopeful that she will improve the business and will be able to sustain a stable source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Elida Marlen

texts.es:
Elida es una joven de 29 años de edad la cual es casada y madre de 3 hijos, 2 estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación y el menor en casa. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundaria completa graduándose como bachiller en promoción social gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres tanto moral como financiero. Su negocio es el comercio se basa en la venta de café uva y café tostado, pan de casa, la venta de plátano y nacatamales ya que desde muy temprana edad a ella le gusto el comercio lo cual aprendió de sus padres. Parte del terreno que ella y su esposo tienen cultivado es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres y la otra parte por medio de la compra la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual en compañía de su esposo se trasladan caminando. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, familiares, amigos e intermediarios que llegan y viven en la zona.
Sus metas son las de seguir cultivando café ya que el negocio dando el cuidado y la asistencia posible al final de la temporada son muchas las recompensas obtenidas de este rubro y más si se le da el valor agregado que actualmente se le da como venderlo molido. Como madre sus metas y sueños son apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, que ellos puedan estudiar a nivel universitario y se puedan graduar siendo buenos profesionales y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café los cuales ella tiene la esperanza y la fe de vender a un buen precio el grano obtenido y generar ganancias para estar un paso más cerca de sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Elida is a young woman of 29. She is married and is mother to three children. Two of her children are studying at primary school in different school years, and the youngest child is at home. Elida completed her secondary education by graduating with a bachelor degree in social work, thanks to the emotional and financial support of her parents.
She has a business selling coffee grapes, roasted coffee, homemade bread, banana and nacatamales [maize, meat and rice in banana leaves]. She does this job because she enjoyed the business from an early age, as she learnt it from her parents.
Part of the land that she and her husband cultivate is their own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents, and the rest they bought. Their land is located 2 km away from their home, and they reach it on foot together. Their customers are their neighbours, family members, friends, and others who come to or live in the area.
Her goal is to continue growing coffee, because with careful input at the end of the season, large rewards are possible, and these are even greater with the added value of ground coffee sales. As a mother, her goals and dreams are to support her children in their studies, so that they can go to university and graduate as good professionals with better life opportunities.
Therefore, she is now requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies for looking after and maintaining her coffee crop, which she hopes to sell at a good price. This will generate profits that will help her move a step closer to achieving her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to improve her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase winter tires and do some maintenance to his car in order to ensure its safety.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is married with four children. Nida is 50 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Nida is a farmer and grows variety of vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 14 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings to plant.

Nida has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Nida hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is 38 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children.
 
Nick is engaged in coconut production and copra-buying and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to purchase additional nuts and copra for his business activity. Nick has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Nick hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nuts and copra.

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
Mia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the ingredients needed in her business. She sells banana cue and other snacks made of rice. Her loan is helpful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is supporting their everyday expenses at home. She is planning to buy a pisonet machine, a computer mounted and assembled in a safe wooden box with a timer which determines how long a player sitting in the seat in front of the machine will be using it.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan so she can buy bananas, sugar, charcoal, oil, milk and other ingredients for her business. She will also use the loan as additional capital in buying the pisonet machine. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mia hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas, sugar, charcoal, oil, milk and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 44 years old and still single at his age. Dennis lives in Looc Proper, Plridel, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Dennis sells eggs to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, he earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase dozens of additional eggs.

Dennis has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Dennis hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 
 
Nilda has a hog fattening activity, and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to use to purchase sacks of feed for her existing hog fattening business. 

Nilda has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed

loans.name: Deejay

texts.en:
Deejay is 23 years old and is single with one child. He lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Deejay is engaged in a business selling coconut and copra and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. He has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Deejay is requesting a loan to purchase additional nuts and copra for his business. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to additional nuts and copra

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 53 years old and married with one child. She lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Philippines. For the past 11 years, Apolonia has been a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

Apolonia is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 37 years old and still single at his age. He lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Philippines. For the past five years, Rolando has sold fish to earn a living. He has been a member of PMPC for three years and earns 10,000 PHP each month.

Rolando is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fish to sell. In the future, he hopes to have enough savings to provide for his future needs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 53 years old and married with four children. He lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Raul works raising hogs and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. He has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Raul is requesting a loan to construct a new fence for his hog raising business. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to construct a new fence

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is married with four children. She is 43 years old and lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Arlyn sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 15,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to purchase fish to sell for her fish-selling business.

Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Arlyn hopes to save enough money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia runs a general store in her village in Oroquieta City. For the past six years she has had this business. Celia earns good money and is able to provide for the needs of her big family. In 2009, she joined GDMPC, and her previous loans used for the business were successfully repaid. Currently, she requests a new loan to buy additional grocery goods for sale. Celia wants to improve the general living standards of her entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
When Juana arrived to the United States from Cuba, she began working at a child care center for three years. It was during this time that Juana developed the desire to start her own business. Juana has now been working in the child care industry for over 11 years and has owned her business for a total of eight years.

To open her business, Juana took numerous courses to attain all her licenses and also took several courses on how to start a home business. She takes care of children ranging in age from infant to 4 years old. On a given week, she cares for approximately seven children. With her earnings, Juana helps to support her family—including three sisters who still live in Cuba. Juana hopes to continue her professional development.

Juana is looking for a loan to help grow her business and build her credit at the same time. She would like to purchase more equipment for her home daycare in order to better care for the children.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for her home daycare.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is widowed with only one child. Teresita is 70 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Teresita is a farmer and grows  rice farm  to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, pesticides and seedlings to plant.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Teresita hopes to have enough savings for her future retirement.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca está casada desde hace 3 años y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su suegros,  para poder subsistir se dedica a la comercialización de comida rápida, vende por las noches en la calle pero cuando llueve no sale por que no tiene un techo donde resguardar a sus comensales lo que le genera un poco de problemas, por este motivo solicita un crédito de Bs. 9230 para terminar de construir un cuarto que da a la calle y en el cual podría trabajar, de esta forma mejoraría su negocio y a la vez sus ingresos.
texts.en: Blanca has been married for three years and doesn’t have any children.  She lives with her in-laws and sells fast food to make a living.  She makes her sales out in the street in the evenings, but not when it’s raining because she doesn’t have a roof under which to place her food and this causes her a bit of a problem.  She is asking for a loan of Bs. 9,230 so she can build a room that faces the street so she can work.  In this way she can improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to build a food stall.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita helped her husband in their fishing business in the village of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She has been selling fish for five years, earning enough so she was able to support her three children's education. 

To boost her business, Margarita took a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy a greater variety of seafood to sell.

She hopes to improve her business, and to see her children successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy a bigger variety of seafood to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
This is Noemi. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of toys and other products. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a pisonet machine, which is a computer mounted in a wooden box with a timer that determines how long a player sits in a seat and uses the arcade-type machine.
 
Noemi would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy more stock of charcoal and use as additional capital for her frozen products. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Noemi hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of charcoal and use as additional capital for her frozen products.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 45-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a clothing business for 15 years. She works six days a week and 12 hours a day. Her business is located on a busy street, thus attracts many customers. A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University and also set up other income-generating activities. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital are her major challenges, while her business plan is to set up a modern boutique. 

Margret is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Jariatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Her children are currently attending school. For the past 10 years, Jariatu has established her clothing material business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Jariatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material and shoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Jariatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material and shoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Msanide

texts.en:
Msanide is 32 years old and happily married with an eight-year-old son.  He accessed his first Kiva loan in June, 2012.  He used the loan to improve his existing Zoona mobile money transfer business.  First, he was able to pay for land rentals, then he purchased a trading booth and some phone equipment to build up his business.  His mobile money shop is located at one of the busiest bus stations in Lusaka, Zambia.  

Msanide has been running his business for over a year now.  He is happy with how the business has given him the opportunity to provide for his family.  Now, he is able to pay his son’s school fees as well as basic household expenses for his family from the profits he earns.  

Msanide is requesting a second loan to continue to grow his existing business.  This loan will be used to add to his working capital so that he can successfully service more customers who are looking to send and receive money from his booth.  Being able to service more customers will bring Msanide additional profit that he can use to reinvest into his business and provide for his family.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money business and serve more customers in need of financial services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for start up costs

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in leather and wood home accents. He would like to purchase leather and hardwoods such as mohena, cedar, and tornillo, as well as in paints, sealers, and lacquer.

Oscar has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story: "When I was 10 years old my father died, leaving me no choice but to work at different jobs. One day, when I was 12, I came upon a carpentry shop where I discovered my vocation for working with wood and leather. I resolved to master the craft, and I did so on my own, learning each step and improving every detail. Now I have my own workshop. I see my work as an art form, not just something to be sold, and my work fills my life in a way I cannot explain." "I would like to thank you for appreciating Peruvian arts and crafts, and for supporting my work through this microcredit. Rest assured I am a hard working person and my products are always of the highest quality because I put my heart, time, and best effort into every piece I make." Use the link below to view Oscar's leather home accents on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4344">http://www.novica.com/kiva/4344

loans.use: to purchase of leather and hardwoods such as mohena, cedar, and tornillo, as well as in paints, sealers, and lacquer

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is a Peruvian artisan who creates modern apparel with Andean alpaca wool. He hopes to purchase materials for his designs. Fernando has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story: "My artistic origins come from my family. My uncles worked in textiles, and little by little they introduced me to this world. I love being able to translate materials into beautiful designs. My work means everything to me: it's what I love and cherish, and I love the fact that I can provide for my family thanks to it." "I'm proud to have been born in Peru, with its rich culture and traditions, where alpaca wool has been used since the times of our ancestors. I'm grateful for the opportunity to carry on this tradition, creating trendy designs that offer warmth as well as beauty. Thanks to Novica, we've been able to bring this tradition to the entire world... how could I not feel proud? Thanks to all of you who appreciate our work and assist us artisans with your purchases and microcredits, we've been able to grow. I think the best path I could have taken in life is the one that led me to you!" Use the link below to view Fernando's alpaca apparel on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7883

loans.use: to purchase materials for his designs

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en: Ana María is a Mexican artisan who specializes in decoupage home decor. She would like to purchase wood, paints, and solvents to increase production. Ana Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story: "For as long as I can remember, I've been around arts and crafts. My whole family produced something, and when we'd visit our relatives, my cousins and I would make something for fun. After I married, my husband and I created various kinds of handicrafts, but I felt a need to make something. I began making decorative boxes, painted by hand with different finishes. Today I create boxes with antique motifs." "I am grateful for the opportunity to receive this microcredit. Thanks to your support, I'll be able to look after my team of artisans and also increase production." Use the link below to view Ana Maria's decoupage home decor on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4592">http://www.novica.com/kiva/4592

loans.use: to purchase wood, paints, and solvents to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her children's university tuition fees and living expenses

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 26 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Ivy works fattening hogs and she earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Ivy is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of feed for her hog-fattening business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia de 31 años de edad habita en condiciones muy sencillas a lado de su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad. Para ella su familia lo es todo y se esfuerza por darles lo mejor cada día. Claudia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pizza desde hace mucho tiempo. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cerco perimetral para lo cual necesita materiales como: tela metálica, postes de cemento, arena, graba, hierro, y ladrillo. Espera poder contar con el apoyo del préstamo.
texts.en: Claudia is 31 years old and lives a simple life with her life’s partner and two daughters, ages 5 and 3.  Family is everything for her and she works daily to provide them with the best.  Claudia has been making and selling pizza for a long time.  This business is her main source of income and is how she and her partner maintain their household finances.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can build a perimeter fence and buy materials such as chain link fencing, cement posts, sand, gravel, and bricks.  She hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. For the past 15 years, she has been vending food in the Philippines. Jocelyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocelyn is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Katharina

texts.en:
After moving to the U.S. from Germany in April 2010, Katharina saw the change in location as a signal for a long-desired change in profession. She was hoping to finally pursue her passion for dogs and establish herself as a businesswoman in her new homeland. When she met Jason, who shared her passion and had over 15 years of experience in dog training, the pair decided to embark on a joint dog-training venture in Jacksonville, Florida.

In March 2012, Katharina and Jason founded Karma K9 and, since then, have been dedicated to helping their busy Jacksonville clients keep their four-legged friends happy and healthy. 

Katharina and Jason are hoping to add more members to their two-person team, strengthen their marketing strategy, and expand their support of non-profit causes and organizations. They hope to work with Veterans and provide service dogs for wounded service men and others in need. 

Fulfilling these goals would be a deeply satisfying accomplishment, both personally and professionally, for Katharina and Jason.

Check out Katharina’s business: www.karma-k9.com.

loans.use: To strengthen marketing strategy and pay for additional employees.

loans.name: Nohn

texts.en:
Nohn is 40 years old, and she has been living in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. It is rich in natural resources, and the living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

She did not go to school, and traditionally, she is married to a local businessman. They have four children whose ages are between 8 months old and 26 years old. Three of her children are in school, and four live at home. Her husband gave her money to start this business. For three years now, she has been running this business, selling salt, onion, rice, oil, and other food items. She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is that she does not have a shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, onion, rice, oil and other food items for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, onion, rice, oil and other food items for her business.

loans.name: Iracema

texts.es: La Señora Iracema sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de comida en su puesto de venta ya que con el anterior crédito lo pudo comprar, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como abarrotes por mayor como arroz y fideos  y así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Iracema continues to sell food from the stall she was able to buy with her previous loan and she says that things went very well with it.  She is asking for a new loan so she can buy ingredients such rice and noodles so she can continue improving her business and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store, which she has had for ten years now. Her loan also was helpful for the education of her children. Cristita’s business income is supporting her family’s everyday household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their family’s everyday expenses.
 
Cristita is requesting another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at her store the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. Cristita’s business profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and provide for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

In the future, Cristita hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Marilia

texts.es:
Marilia vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, para poder salir adelante logro iniciar hace 2 años su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, con lo cual tiene un ingreso para poder salir adelante,

Marilia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería a su negocio como perfumes, maquillaje, cremas y también podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su pequeña movilidad con la cual reparte sus productos a sus clientes; de esta manera ella podrá atender mejor a sus clientes, mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un loca propio y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Marilia lives in the city of Pucallpa. In order to get ahead she started a small business selling beauty products two years ago. This has given her the income to get ahead.

Marilia is pleased with the lenders from Kiva as thanks to their help she can buy more merchandise for her business like perfume, make-up and creams. As well she can do some maintenance on a small vehicle she uses to distribute her products to her clients. In this way she can server her clients better, increase her revenues and continue to struggle to fulfill her big dream, which is to have her own store and to be able to study at university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
In the past, Christina and her husband's source of income was working for someone who had a farm or working as a laborer. When they had enough earnings, Christina and her husband decided to sell eggs in the market. 

While running the business earns a profit, they use their earnings as revolving capital to expand their business and meet all their customers' demands on time.
